page.title: 03 CHARLECOTE PARK & HOUSE(1)
page.content: The history of the family who founded the house can be traced back to before the Conquest. The present house,on the site of an even older manor house,was begun by Thomas Lucy in 1551 when he inherited at the age of 19,and he was knighted for his work as Commissioner of Musters in 1565. The house and the land is now owned by the National Trust(since 1945). Internally,the House is Victorian, having been 'modernised' and enlarged in 1823 by George Hammond Lucy. The letter to Richard Lucy,displayed in the House,and signed by Oliver Cromwell,is a reminder of the proximity to Edgehill.Before the battle,it is believed that both armies forded the Avon at Charlecote Park. (cont'd on p.4)
